intro: Cotyledon woodii subsp. woodii, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, paddle-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptability to arid environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
